meanings.definition: To break or smash something into pieces.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally busticated the vase when I dropped it.
meanings.sent2: The hammer can easily busticate the glass bottle.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle the eggs, I managed to busticate them all.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake busticated the fragile bridge into rubble.
meanings.sent5: The angry toddler proceeded to busticate his tower of blocks in a fit of rage.

meanings.sent1: The storm will busticate our picnic plans if it continues.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the milk out in the sun will busticate its freshness.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to water the plants may busticate their chances of survival.
meanings.sent4: The villain's evil plan was to busticate the hero's reputation.
meanings.sent5: The careless mistake could busticate the entire project if not corrected in time.

meanings.definition: To defeat or overcome someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The skilled boxer managed to busticate his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent2: With determination, she was able to busticate her fear of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The clever detective busticated the criminal's alibi with solid evidence.
meanings.sent4: The underdog team busticated the reigning champions in a surprising victory.
meanings.sent5: The knight's bravery helped him busticate the dragon threatening the kingdom.
